thread.title: No. 23 Virginia denies No. 5 North Carolina's bid to clinch ACC title
thread.title_full: No. 23 Virginia denies No. 5 North Carolina's bid to clinch ACC title

author: USA TODAY Sports
title: No. 23 Virginia denies No. 5 North Carolina's bid to clinch ACC title
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email No. 23 Virginia denies No. 5 North Carolina's bid to clinch ACC title The Cavaliers' defense frustrated the Tar Heels throughout. Post to Facebook No. 23 Virginia denies No. 5 North Carolina's bid to clinch ACC title The Cavaliers' defense frustrated the Tar Heels throughout. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs No. 23 Virginia denies No. 5 North Carolina's bid to clinch ACC title USA TODAY Sports 8:47 p.m. ET Feb. 27, 2017 North Carolina guard Joel Berry II shoots over Virginia guard Kyle Guy. (Photo: Geoff Burke, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Virginia denied North Carolina its bid to claim the outright ACC regular-season title on Monday. 
At least for the time being. 
The No. 23 Cavaliers managed to slow the No. 5 Tar Heels offense throughout the game on the way to a 53-43 victory at John Paul Jones Arena in Charlottesville, Va. North Carolina (25-6, 13-4 ACC) shot less than 40% from the field and was held to its lowest point total of the season. 
The Cavaliers (20-9, 10-7) have won two in a row after struggling through a four-game losing streak, and they ended North Carolina's four-game winning streak. 
North Carolina closes out its regular season on Saturday at home against Duke. Virginia hosts Pittsburgh on Saturday. NEVER MISS OUT Sports Stay in the know and in the zone, 7 days a week, with scores, analysis, and in-depth features and commentary. THANKS FOR SIGNING UP FOR THE Sports NEWSLETTER 
We're sorry.
